revised_title: Physiological Action of Benzene and Its Compounds: A Study of Chemical Constitution and Physiological Effects
tldr: This article examines the physiological effects of benzene and its compounds on the nervous system, muscles, and organs. The authors investigate how different chemical substitutions in benzene affect its action on the body, including its impact on reflexes, respiration, and circulation. They also describe a new method for measuring blood pressure and pulse during experiments.
